definitions.definition: In functional programming, a kind of higher-order function that is the opposite of a fold.

definitions.example: to unfold a map; to unfold a tablecloth; she unpacks the new dress and unfolds it carefully

definitions.definition: To turn out; to happen; to develop.
To open (anything covered or closed); to lay open to view or contemplation; to bring out in all the details, or by successive development.
definitions.example: to unfold one's designs;  to unfold the principles of a science

definitions.definition: To release from a fold or pen.
